papers.title: An Offline Dictionary Attack Against zkPAKE Protocol
papers.authors: José Becerra, Peter Y. A. Ryan, Petra Sala, Marjan Skrobot
papers.abstract: Password Authenticated Key Exchange (PAKE) allows a user to establish a secure cryptographic key with a server, using only knowledge of a pre-shared password. One of the basic security requirements of PAKE is to prevent offline dictionary attacks. In this paper, we revisit zkPAKE, an augmented PAKE that has been recently proposed by Mochetti, Resende, and Aranha (SBSeg 2015). Our work shows that the zkPAKE protocol is prone to offline password guessing attack, even in the presence of an adversary that has only eavesdropping capabilities. Therefore, zkPAKE is insecure and should not be used as a password-authenticated key exchange mechanism.
papers.abstract_zh: 口令认证密钥交换(PAKE)允许用户仅使用预共享口令的知识与服务器建立安全的加密密钥。PAKE的一个基本安全需求是防止离线字典攻击。在本文中，我们重新考察了zkPAKE，这是最近由Mochetti、Resende和Aranha (SBSeg 2015)提出的一种扩充的PAKE。我们的工作表明，zkPAKE协议很容易受到离线密码猜测攻击，即使对手只有窃听能力。所以zkPAKE是不安全的，不应该作为密码认证的密钥交换机制。
papers.title_zh: 针对zkPAKE协议的离线字典攻击

papers.title: Information Sharing and User Privacy in the Third-Party Identity Management Landscape
papers.authors: Anna Vapen, Niklas Carlsson, Anirban Mahanti, Nahid Shahmehri
papers.abstract: Third-party identity management services enable cross-site information sharing, making Web access seamless but also raise significant privacy implications for the users. Using a combination of manual analysis of identified third-party identity management relationships and targeted case studies we capture how the protocol usage and third-party selection is changing, profile what information is requested to be shared (and actions to be performed) between websites, and identify privacy issues and practical problems that occur when using multiple accounts (associated with these services). The study highlights differences in the privacy leakage risks associated with different classes of websites, and shows that the use of multiple third-party websites, in many cases, can cause the user to lose (at least) partial control over which information is shared/posted on their behalf.
papers.abstract_zh: 第三方身份管理服务支持跨站点信息共享，使Web访问变得无缝，但也给用户带来了严重的隐私问题。通过结合对已识别的第三方身份管理关系的手动分析和有针对性的案例研究，我们了解了协议使用和第三方选择是如何变化的，描述了网站之间需要共享的信息(以及要执行的操作)，并确定了使用多个帐户(与这些服务相关)时出现的隐私问题和实际问题。该研究强调了与不同类别网站相关的隐私泄露风险的差异，并表明在许多情况下，使用多个第三方网站会导致用户失去(至少)对代表他们共享/发布的信息的部分控制。
papers.title_zh: 第三方身份管理环境中的信息共享和用户隐私
